title: Hardest Champion to Play?
body:
So Through understanding almost everyone's mechanics who would undoubtedly be the most difficult champion to play exceptionally well. 

My Vote goes to {{champion:268}}

replies.body: Low mobility squishies in my books. If you ask me complexity is only half the factor that goes into what makes a champion hard to play.
Azir, Draven, Vayne, maybe Nidalee are all exceptionally difficult.

> [{quoted}](name=SoeBomb,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pWHrmG0Q,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-04-02T21:00:02.755+0000)
>
> Azir, Draven, Vayne, maybe Nidalee are all exceptionally difficult.

I can agree with Azir, Draven and Vayne. I don't really think Nidalee is to hard personally.

> [{quoted}](name=EdgeEddgeNEdgy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pWHrmG0Q,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-04-02T21:06:38.774+0000)
>
> I can agree with Azir, Draven and Vayne. I don't really think Nidalee is to hard personally.

She has a lot of auto resets and cancels she can do that are difficult

And once you learn how to do them, you've mastered her forever.

Meanwhile, a Draven or an Azir might have to adapt to a situation that they've never encountered before even after 1000 games.
I disagree with Vayne and Nidalee. Draven and Azir are certainly a step up from those two in my opinion and experience.
